title: Police investigate two homicides in Prince William County
text:
Police said Tuesday that they are investigating two homicides that occurred hours apart in Prince William County.

In the first incident, a 45-year-old man was fatally shot Monday night inside a home in the 1300 block of E Street in Woodbridge, according to Prince William police.

Authorities said they were called to investigate a report of a shooting around 9:50 p.m., and when officers arrived, they found a man suffering from gunshot wounds. He was taken to a hospital, where he later died, police said.

The victim was identified as Stonnie Ray Chavis of Woodbridge. Detectives are trying to determine a motive and said a “gathering” was going on at the house when the shooting happened.

In the second incident, officers responded to the 3100 block of Chesapeake Drive in Dumfries about 3:50 a.m. Tuesday for a report of a shooting. and found a man suffering from gunshot wounds lying in the road, police said.

The man was taken to a hospital, where he died. Police identified the man Wednesday as Antonio Kaoul Smith, 37, of Dumfries. Police are investigating the circumstances of the shooting.

No arrests have been made in either killing.
